itemDescription: Scottish minister of the Church of Scotland

wikipedia_page.main: William Paul (1754–1802) was a minister of the Church of Scotland who was patriarch to a number of eminent Scottish ministers. He was Chaplain in Ordinary to King George III.

response: * William Paul (1754–1802), Chaplain in Ordinary in Scotland to King George III of the United Kingdom
* The Rev William Paul (1754–1802), Chaplain in Ordinary to George III (in church)

He was born on 12 March 1795 the son of Rev William Paul (1754–1802), minister of the collegiate section of St Cuthbert's Church, Edinburgh and his wife Susan Moncrieff. He was also nephew of Rev Henry Moncrieff-Wellwood first charge minister of the same church.Fasti Ecclesiastae Scoticana by Hew Scott The family lived at Castlebarns in the Tollcross area south of the church.Williamsons Edinburgh Directory 1795 By 1805 his father had died and he was living with his mother in the West Kirk manse.Edinburgh Post Office directory 1805
